title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
OB: When I close the file, go to the Java Perspective, and open a java file by double clicking on it, the file is successfully opened in the workbench. However, when I right click on the Java file and select 'Open With .. System Editor', nothing happens. The workbench should display a warning message saying that there may be changes that could be overwritten and ask if I want to continue. Alternatively, an error message should be displayed indicating that I should close all other files first. We believe this is a safety feature where the editor does not allow external editing when a file is already opened within the editor.
EB: When I right click on the Java file and select 'Open With .. System Editor', a warning message should be displayed, informing me that there may be changes that could be overwritten and asking if I want to continue. Alternatively, an error message should be displayed indicating that I should close all other files first before opening the file in another editor.
SR:
1. Close the file
2. Go to the Java Perspective
3. Open a java file by double clicking on it
4. Right click on the Java file
5. Select 'Open With .. System Editor'
  - Expected: a warning message should be displayed, asking if I want to continue or an error message should be displayed indicating that all other files should be closed first
  - Observed: no warning or error message is displayed
